text: Question for anyone watching now: It was stated that the filters pre-training and after-training are not the same, yet I'm not sure how do the filters themselves get optimized? Because the input nodes come after the filters, activations, and pooling, and the only thing optimized after the input nodes are present are the weights and biases that lead it to some output. So how do the filters go to the diagonal bottom left to top right from some other initialized arrangement of the filter? Any help is appreciated.

author: @grantkim9124
text: I was a undergrad poli-sci data analytics student three years ago. I couldn't imagine myself going into data science because I know I am not a STEM student nor do I have a great working brain for math. But when I watched your videos back then, I was able to get confidence that I can give myself a chance to study DS which I love. Here, three years later, I am in the MSDS program at Columbia University studying data science. This was only possible because of your ml/stats videos. I still find myself studying your videos to understand concepts, which allows me to read the text without spending countless days stuck. I sincerely thank you very much for giving me a chance to actually dive on such a complex but cool subject.

author: @brindasapra2697
text: While doing max pooling, why does the size of filter become 2x2? i.e. we search for the maximum value among 4 cells, instead of the original size of the filter which was 9 cells  Input image has 6x6 = 36 cells Filter (initialised randomly) has 3x3 = 9 cells Feature map has 4x4 = 16 cells Max pooling is done over 2x2 = 4 cells, at a time  Its clear that number of cells in max pooling matrix is equal to number of inputs to NN. But what is the logic behind how to select the dimensions of filter, feature map, and max pooling?

author: @sagaradoshi
text: Hello Josh, I have never come across such an easy explanation of neural networks. I thank you for this video.  I have one question. When do we provide input to Relu function? When do we provide input to maxx pooling and finally when do we provide input to neural network? The reason I am asking this is due to sliding window concept which covers initially part of image and then slides over to cover entire image. So do we apply input to Relu when we have filled only few values in input feature map (because sliding is still ongoing on main input image) or we apply input to Relu when entire feature map is filled with data. Similarly on when we provide input to max pooling? Is it when we have finished Relu on entire feature map because Relu also take once cell of feature map ,perform Relu and give output. And finally when is input provided to NN? Is it after we have finished complete Max pooling? as it also works on sliding window concept.
